content.description: A really fun problem.  Move off scoops to right sidepull, then crank over the lip.  Straight up the arete is V5, moving up and right is V4.  The top out is fairly high, but the last 10ish feet are V0-.
content.location: Southwest corner of Tee Pee Boulder. Should be on Ripple boulder. -SF

content.description: Dyno off obvious flake to top.  Sit start.
content.location: Southeast corner of Solitude

content.description: Low squat start on gastons. Move up left hand to a small crimp and join the the V2 to topout.
content.location: 5 feet to the right of the crack.

content.description:
Super fun, aesthetic boulder with a techy finish. Start sitting under an oblique arete on obvious crimps, fire up into the jug that starts the "Teepee Traverse, v8" and then finish on that problem. Very cool crimps to start, a fun traverse, and a highlight technical topout on the end of the traverse. Great fun.

Often given v10.
content.protection: Nice to have several pads to protect the somewhat complicated landing, as well as the trav. Not bad, but maybe more complicated to protect than the average Moes boulder.
content.location: This is a sit start to the Teepee Traverse. Start with butt on ground and use thin edges to get up to the jug start of TT, then finish this boulder. You'll find this problem around the corner left of Hermione, on the Teepee Boulder.

content.description: A cool little traverse with great stone and a cool technical finish. Starts on the rad, obvious jug, and cuts hard left, then up a flying arete. Very fun, reminiscent of Mr Moran, and worth doing if you have the pads to protect it. One of the better v8s around Moes.
content.protection: several pads are nice. Not bad, but maybe a bit harder to protect than most boulders in Moes because of the landing at the end, on the crux topout.
content.location: Around the corner left of Hermione, nearly underneath the "teepee" formed by the two rocks. Start on a large two handed jug, and work your way left across the hanging lip, then finish up the flying arete.

content.description:
Sit start with left hand on good side-pull at chest level, right hand on ~nothing. move up to big fin, then left to crimp around arete, then up to good lip.

more interesting movement than expected.

alternate beta (book): Awkward sit-start to fin, reachy move to sloper then up.
content.location: climbs the southeast arete of Teepee. (right of Hermione, Solid-Toad, and Teepee Dyno)

content.description: Sit start undercling  to small edges  commitng top out.
content.location: Just right of Hermione

content.description: Start matched on undercling slopers and move to a good crimp rail and up to the top.  A shorty but a goody, and probably soft.
content.location: On the overhanging SW face with Funky Fish (V7) to the right and Rob's Tweaker (V9) to the Left.

content.description:
Same start as athlete's foot (v9), but instead of crossing with the right hand for the glassy crimp beginning, you go up with your left and sink a gnarly crystal crimp with the right hand.

Awkward feet and intermediate crimps or a big move get you to the lip.

The guidebook gives it v9. Personally, I found this to be a slight case of inflation. Leaving it as the guidebook grade, but I invite everyone to vote on it.
content.location: Left of shoulder popper.

content.description: Sit start on the lowest section of the rock in a sandy pit, pull into sharp patina edges and then to the lip and top out awkwardly. Only for those who have done everything else, and not very good.
content.location: The left side of the Shoulder Popper wall, sit start on the very left arete.

content.description:
Sharp, steep, and a bit sandbagged, but climbs really nicely.

I started with the left hand sharp pocket (shared with Funky Fish), and a right hand undercling. Funky Fish is a bit of an eliminate, but this line is fairly obvious, and all holds are on.

I fired left to a slot that you have to hit quick, or your ass is back on the ground, and then up right to a super cool undercling. Unexpectedly high value.
content.location: Find the shoulder popper wall, a low wall on the downhill backside of the teepee boulder. Find this steep, dark section about 2/3 of the way across the wall to the right, then find a sharp hand sized pocket (left hand) and a nice juggy undercling (for the right).

content.description: Small crimps and slopers up face, big move to huge edge near top
content.location: Teepee (south side)

content.description:
A variation to "Swelter" that exits up the face via a shallow crimp rail. It may have been climbed before but after three of us sent it we decided to put something on here so more people would enjoy it.

Start sitting with the right hand on the good crimp under the overhang, left hand wherever you can comfortably reach while sitting. Left heel helps to traverse the lip and get to the two "dishes" then a mantel to a high crimp with your left hand and the top-out.
content.location: Boulder faces north, you see it when walking in from the parking/ walking south. Same start as "Swelter"

content.description: Start in the same holds as Athlete's Foot and Rob's Tweaker, bust out to the right to get on the same line as Shoulder Popper, then finish the standard way.
content.location: Backside of the Teepee Boulder, left of shoulder popper.

content.description: Start as low as you can and try to knee bar, foot jam or body squeeze your way up. I found a head jam to be very helpful in some places.
content.location: the obvious crack that splits the boulder in half inside the cave

content.description: Similar to other problems on this short face, techy and powerful.
content.protection: One or two pads are enough.
content.location: Sit start with hands matched on the obvious sharp pocket. About 5 feet to the right of shoulder popper.

content.description: Start in cave entrance, traverse right on interesting edges to slab-mantle
content.location: Teepee (west side) starts just inside the cave of the teepee

content.description:
Ha! Good fun on the teepee boulder. Characterized by lots of moves, and a redpoint crux to topout at the end. Really nice climbing all the way through.

I started on the Thing, perched on that left foot, and fired up left. I didn't use the big jugs over the lip, instead staying on the good crimps below, on the tan rock. Cut left into the start of the Teepee Traverse, and finish on that problem with the funky mantel. Nice movement and three distinct cruxes.

Maybe a bit harder than Thermal Detonator? Let me know. I'm not invested in it being a certain grade.

It's right in the heart of the area, so there's a good chance it's been done. Let me know if you or someone you know has already done this, and I'll update it.
content.location: Start on the Thing, which is on two gastons, and a left foot, perched. This is left of Hermione, on the Teepee boulder.

climbs.name: Detonating Equestrians with a Thermal Optics Equipped Bazooka

content.description: Sit start on Thermal Detonator and do the big dyno to a large jug. Punch right to finish on Equestranauts.
content.location: On the back of the Teepee Boulder

content.description: Step high onto slab and scramble up crack and edges
content.location: Teepee boulder (south side)up obvious crack

content.description: Sit-start, big move to unique pocket then up arete to tight chimney squeeze (beach whale)
content.location: Teepee (north side) starts just inside the cave

content.description: Slight over-hang to big shelf. From the shelf, move straight up to the top out. Crux is above the shelf.
content.location: Obvious arete to the left of Cornered

content.description:
The best of the hard little boulders around Shoulder Popper? I think the movement on this is really good. The holds are fun and solid.

Keep in mind there's a mess of variations in here, all of which seem to go in the vicinity of 8-9.

Start in the hueco on the right, work up through the gorgeous crimp on the face, span out left to the bullet iron crimp, and pop to the lip. Great stone, great movement, worth doing if you can handle the nest of variations of this little overhang.
content.location: Left of the shoulder popper on the downhill side of the teepee boulder

content.description: Start as Funky Fish and traverse left into Shoulder Popper and finish as such.
